sentences.sContent: The field of aesthetics presents an especially difficult problem to the historian.
sentences.sContent_eng: The field of aesthetics presents an especially difficult problem to the historian.
sentences.sCn: 美学领域向历史学家提出了一个格外困难的问题。

sentences.sContent: What one knows is, in youth, of little moment; they know enough who know how to learn. —Henry Adams, American historian and novelist.
sentences.sContent_eng: What one knows is, in youth, of little moment; they know enough who know how to learn. —Henry Adams, American historian and novelist.
sentences.sCn: 一个人年轻时学识多少无关紧要；重要的是懂得如何去学习。 —亨利·亚当斯，美国历史学家及小说家。

sentences.sContent: Ian Morris, a Stanford historian and author of Why the West Rules—For Now, has constructed an "index of development" that takes into account urbanization.
sentences.sContent_eng: Ian Morris, a Stanford historian and author of Why the West Rules—For Now, has constructed an "index of development" that takes into account urbanization.
sentences.sCn: 伊恩·莫里斯，一个斯坦福大学的历史学家和《西方将主宰多久》的作家，设计了一项考虑到城市化的“发展指数”。

words.tran: 历史的；史学的；基于史实的
有历史意义的；历史上著名的
历史上地；从历史观点上说
历史，历史学；历史记录；来历

trans.tranCn: 历史学家， 史学工作者
trans.tranOther: A historian is a person who specializes in the study of history, and who writes books and articles about it
